title: allow comparison with a struct/array literal
body:
by **beatgammit**: 
What does 'go version' print?
go version go1.3 linux/amd64

What steps reproduce the problem?
http://play.golang.org/p/cu3sN6qMZI

What happened?
Doesn't compile

What should have happened instead?
Should have compiled and printed the body in the conditional.


This is really handy for testing if a type is the zero value without using reflection. I
have been using the first example (*new(T)), but that feels like a hack and is probably
inefficient (assuming it hasn't been optimized). I don't want to do the second because
that requires another variable that will only be used once.
